comment.author: 59430401@N06
comment._content: Governor Sir Evelyn Home with newly appointed Colonial Secretary Ian Macleod at Lusaka airport early 1960s.  Crowd restrained by Northern Rhodesia Police Assistant Inspector and toppee-wearing constable

comment.author: 59430401@N06
comment._content: The Governor's name was Hone not Home.  Sorry! I got my agony aunts mixed up.

comment.author: 30937372@N00
comment._content: This is probably the 'bare-breasted' protest at Lusaka Airport in 1960 at the start of a visit by Ian Macleod when a group of women led by Julia Chikamoneka (popularly called 'Mama UNIP) stripped to the waist in front of the British Secretary of State for the Colonies
